intro: Matelea pusilliflora, commonly known as the small-flowered matelea, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture, while the stems are woody and branching. Matelea pusilliflora is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and undergrowth.
